Mark Baker wrote, in message 3721:

> If it's a URI, then there's nothing a=
t all RESTless about it.

Hmm, I think that a URI containing a session key,=
 like Java's
;jsession=3D12345 mechanism used when cookies are turned off,
=
probably isn't RESTful. It's just a hack to pass around a handle
for applic=
ation state on the server and an abuse of the URI
syntax. That's not the ca=
se you were talking about it this
thread, but it was my first reaction to t=
his one sentence...

Justin
